nodes.title: Add Cursor assignment flow
nodes.description:
Based on your Bifrost Bridge project and existing Linear/Cursor integration work, here's how to set up the Linear API to assign issues to Cursor in alignment with your architecture.\[[perplexity](<https://www.perplexity.ai/search/55a1e46c-4206-4aa7-96b4-bda86a1b538a>)\]â€‹

## Linear API Configuration for Cursor Assignment

Your Bifrost Bridge setup treats Linear as the source of truth with optional Cursor integration for isolated task execution. The system works through branch naming conventions and automatic PR creation rather than direct API assignment.\[[perplexity](<https://www.perplexity.ai/search/55a1e46c-4206-4aa7-96b4-bda86a1b538a>)\]â€‹

## API Setup Requirements

Get your Linear API key from your workspace settings (Settings â†’ API â†’ Personal API Keys). Store it in your environment:

```
bash
```

`LINEAR_API_KEY=lin_api_xxxxx CURSOR_API_KEY=optional # Only needed for cloud agent assignment`

Since you're running this on Cloudflare Workers with your fly.io router stack, you'll want these in your Cloudflare environment variables rather than a local `.env`.

## Cursor Assignment Workflow

Cursor can work two ways with Linear: autonomous cloud agents or local IDE-triggered work. For Bifrost Bridge's architecture, the cloud agent approach aligns better since it treats Linear as the state spine while agents execute autonomously.[History+1](<https://www.perplexity.ai/search/02d2a788-3ccd-40d2-b987-cd103ed41776>)

When you assign an issue to `@Cursor` in Linear, it spins up a cloud agent that works independentlyâ€”no local Cursor IDE needed. The agent analyzes the issue, writes code, runs tests, and creates PRs while updating Linear automatically.\[[perplexity](<https://www.perplexity.ai/search/02d2a788-3ccd-40d2-b987-cd103ed41776>)\]â€‹

## Branch-Based Integration Pattern

The more reliable pattern for your workflow is using Linear's branch name generation rather than direct API assignment. Your router can create Linear issues programmatically, then generate feature branches that trigger the workflow:

1. Linear issue created via API with proper labeling and team assignment
2. Branch name generated from issue: `eng-1-fix-world-creation-error`
3. Router creates branch and assigns work to appropriate agent (DeepSeek/Gemini for heavy lifting, Cursor for isolated tasks)\[[perplexity](<https://www.perplexity.ai/search/55a1e46c-4206-4aa7-96b4-bda86a1b538a>)\]â€‹
4. PR creation automatically syncs status back to Linear

## Agent Routing Logic

Your existing system already has the intelligence layerâ€”route work based on Linear metadata:\[[perplexity](<https://www.perplexity.ai/search/55a1e46c-4206-4aa7-96b4-bda86a1b538a>)\]â€‹

* **Team/Project ID**: Determines which codebase and deployment target
* **Labels**: Signal complexity (nano/micro/mini issues map to different models)\[[perplexity](<https://www.perplexity.ai/search/02d2a788-3ccd-40d2-b987-cd103ed41776>)\]â€‹
* **Priority/Status**: Trigger automation rules in your fly.io router

For Cursor specifically, route issues labeled as isolated, well-scoped tasks with clear file boundariesâ€”these work best within Cursor's context window limitations.\[[perplexity](<https://www.perplexity.ai/search/6cfd4de4-8b6e-47de-9279-247bce0b5495>)\]â€‹

## API Endpoints for Assignment

Use Linear's GraphQL API for programmatic issue management. The key mutations you need:

* `issueCreate`: Generate issues from Perplexity/DeepSeek analysis with TL;DR, priorities, relationships
* `issueUpdate`: Change status, add comments with progress updates
* `attachmentCreate`: Link commits, PRs, and router job IDs to issues

## Model Selection for Cursor

Current limitation: Linear-assigned Cursor tasks always use premium models (Claude Sonnet 4, GPT-4.2, Gemini Pro). You can't specify lightweight models like Flash/Haiku through Linear assignment yet. For cost optimization, trigger lightweight model work through your router's direct API calls instead of Linear assignment.\[[perplexity](<https://www.perplexity.ai/search/6cfd4de4-8b6e-47de-9279-247bce0b5495>)\]â€‹

## Observability Integration

Since your system emphasizes transparent workflows, pipe Linear webhook events into your router for real-time state tracking. Every status change, comment addition, or PR link should flow through your observability layer so you can see exactly what each agent (including Cursor) is doing.\[[perplexity](<https://www.perplexity.ai/search/55a1e46c-4206-4aa7-96b4-bda86a1b538a>)\]â€‹

The key insight: Linear assignment to Cursor is optional in your architecture because your router is already the orchestration brain. Use Cursor assignment for tasks where you want fully autonomous execution with PR creation, but keep your router as the decision-maker for which agent (Jules/DeepSeek/Gemini/Cursor) handles each piece of work.\[[perplexity](<https://www.perplexity.ai/search/55a1e46c-4206-4aa7-96b4-bda86a1b538a>)\]â€‹

nodes.title: [AUTO-001] Linear Metadata Quality Assurance System
nodes.description:
**Priority**: P1 | **Estimate**: 90 min

## Problem

Linear issues created by agents often lack complete metadata:

* Priorities not set (defaults to None)
* Labels missing (no filtering/grouping)
* Dependencies not linked (text-only "Deps: X")
* Milestones unassigned (no phased delivery tracking)

This reduces project management effectiveness and makes filtering/sorting difficult.

## Solution: Pre-Flight Metadata Validator

Create system that validates and enforces metadata quality BEFORE issue creation.

### Implementation

**File**: `src/utils/linear-metadata-validator.ts`

**Core Functions**:

1. `validateIssueMetadata(issue)`: Pre-creation validation

```typescript
interface IssueMetadata {
  title: string;
  description: string;
  priority?: number;        // 0-4, default 3
  labels?: string[];        // ['sprites', 'month-2']
  milestone?: string;       // 'Month 2'
  blockedBy?: string[];     // ['BIF-70']
}

// Auto-infer from description if missing:
- Extract "P1" -> priority = 2 (High)
- Extract "MONTH 2" -> milestone = 'Month 2'
- Extract "Deps: BIF-X" -> blockedBy = ['BIF-X']
```

2. `enrichMetadata(issue)`: Auto-populate from description

```typescript
// Parse description for:
- Priority markers ("P0", "P1", "P2", "P3") -> priority field
- Phase markers ("MONTH 2", "MONTH 3") -> milestone
- Dependencies ("Deps: BIF-70") -> blockedBy relations
- Category keywords ("Sprites", "Security") -> labels
```

3. `auditExistingIssues(projectId)`: Scan for incomplete metadata

```typescript
// Report issues with:
- No priority set
- No labels
- Text dependencies not linked
- Missing milestones for phased work
```

### Integration Points

**Update**: `src/linear-client.ts` - `createIssue()`

```typescript
async createIssue(data: IssueInput) {
  // NEW: Enrich metadata before creation
  const enriched = enrichMetadata(data);
  
  // NEW: Validate metadata quality
  validateIssueMetadata(enriched);
  
  // Existing: Create issue
  return this.query(mutation, enriched);
}
```

**Add**: `scripts/audit_linear_metadata.ts`

```bash
npm start -- audit-metadata
# Output: Report of all issues missing metadata
```

**Add**: `scripts/fix_metadata.ts`

```bash
npm start -- fix-metadata --dry-run
npm start -- fix-metadata --apply
# Re-process all issues, enrich metadata from descriptions
```

### Validation Rules

**Minimum Required**:

- [ ] Priority set (default to 3 if unspecified)
- [ ] At least 1 label
- [ ] Description >50 chars
- [ ] Title <120 chars

**Best Practice** (warnings):

- [ ] Milestone for phased work (Month 2, Month 3)
- [ ] Dependencies linked (not just text)
- [ ] Time estimate in description
- [ ] Acceptance criteria present

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `validateIssueMetadata()` function created
- [ ] `enrichMetadata()` auto-infers from description text
- [ ] `createIssue()` calls validation before GraphQL mutation
- [ ] `audit_linear_metadata.ts` script reports gaps
- [ ] `fix_metadata.ts` script bulk-enriches existing issues
- [ ] README documents metadata standards

## Dependencies

* BIF-101 (auth hardening) - ensures proper API access

## Testing

* Create issue with "P1 | MONTH 2 | Deps: BIF-70" in description
* Verify auto-populated: priority=2, milestone='Month 2', blockedBy=\['BIF-70'\]
* Run audit on existing 32 issues
* Verify report shows missing labels, milestones

## Notes

This ensures ALL future agent-created issues meet metadata quality standards automatically.

nodes.title: [SEC-001] Harden Linear Authentication - Prevent Key/Secret Confusion
nodes.description:
**Priority**: P0 (URGENT) | **Estimate**: 60 min

## Problem

During bulk issue creation, the script conflated authentication keys:

* Used `PROXY_API_KEY` (webhook secret `lin_wh_*`) as API auth key
* Should have used `LINEAR_API_KEY` (`lin_api_*`) for API calls
* Circuit breaker activated due to 401 errors from wrong key type

## Solution: Runtime Key Validation

**File**: `src/linear-client.ts`

**Implementation**:

1. Add key type detection in constructor:

```typescript
if (apiKey.startsWith('lin_wh_')) {
  throw new LinearAuthenticationError(
    'Webhook secret detected! Use LINEAR_API_KEY (lin_api_*), not LINEAR_WEBHOOK_SECRET (lin_wh_*)'
  );
}
if (!apiKey.startsWith('lin_api_')) {
  logger.warn('API key does not match expected pattern (lin_api_*)');
}
```

2. Add .env validation script:

```bash
# scripts/validate_env.ts
- Check LINEAR_API_KEY starts with 'lin_api_'
- Check LINEAR_WEBHOOK_SECRET starts with 'lin_wh_'  
- Check PROXY_API_KEY doesn't start with 'lin_wh_'
```

3. Update CLI helper (src/cli.ts getLinearClient):

```typescript
// Clear comment explaining key usage:
// LINEAR_API_KEY: For API calls to Linear
// LINEAR_WEBHOOK_SECRET: For verifying incoming webhooks  
// PROXY_API_KEY: For authenticating to linear-proxy (if using proxy)
```

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Constructor throws error if webhook secret passed as API key
- [ ] New `scripts/validate_env.ts` validates all Linear keys
- [ ] Run validation in `npm start` hook (pre-flight check)
- [ ] Clear inline comments in cli.ts explaining each key's purpose
- [ ] Update README with key usage table

## Dependencies

None - standalone security hardening

## Testing

* Try passing webhook secret â†’ should fail fast with clear error
* Run validate_env.ts â†’ should pass with current .env
* Manually swap keys â†’ should catch and report misconfigurations
